byline.contributor: Nick Corasaniti and Michael M. Grynbaum contributed reporting.

abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo and New Jersey Gov Chris Christie, in separate statements, call on federal government to provide funding for new railway tunnels under Hudson River; Christie continues to defend 2010 decision to cancel tunnel project for financial reasons; recent New Jersey Transit service disruptions have drawn renewed attention to neglected state of region's rail infrastructure.
lead_paragraph: The governors of New York and New Jersey, addressing a push to expand rail capacity under the Hudson River, put the onus on the federal government and Amtrak.

headline.main: Cuomo and Christie Call on U.S. to Share Cost of Hudson Rail Tunnel Project
headline.print_headline: Cuomo and Christie Call on U.S. to Share Cost of New Hudson Tunnels

snippet: The governors of New York and New Jersey, addressing a push to expand rail capacity under the Hudson River, put the onus on the federal government and Amtrak.
